_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Devon Energy Corporation
Hill County 1
Executive Summary

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES

Devon Energy Corporation has a long-standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, and mitigation, such as training personnel and considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of our processes. Devon's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. However, if a release does occur, trained personnel will respond to control and contain the release.

DESCRIPTION OF THE HILL COUNTY 1 FACILITY AND OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS RESULTS 

The Hill County 1 facility, located approximately 8 miles south of Havre in Hill County, Montana, operates a propane refrigeration plant to extract liquid petroleum products from raw natural gas.  The plant products include pipeline quality natural gas (primarily methane) and natural gas liquids comprised of ethane, propane, butane, pentane, and heavier hydrocarbons, some of which are regulated flammable substances.  The process to represent all regulated flammable substances at the Hill County 1 facility which contain above the threshold quantity is as follows:

? Product Storage Tank comprised of C2+ mixture.

In order to establish the safest possible environment for our employees and the public, there are no regulated toxic substances above the threshold quantity present at the Hill County 1 facility.  

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

Because the process at the Hill County 1 facility which is regulated by the EPA RMP rule are not subject to the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation, no additional steps for accidental release prevention are required.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

As this is the initial RMP filing for the Hill County 1 facility, there have been no accidental releases that have occurred in the past 5 years that have resulted

in offsite effects.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM INFORMATON

The overall emergency response program for the Hill County 1 facility is coordinated with the Hill County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the local fire department.  This provides a means of notifying the public of an incident, if necessary, as well as facilitating quick response to an incident.

CONCLUSION

The Hill County 1 facility has had very safe operations over its brief history.  However, the facility continually looks for improvements, both to the process and to safety issues at the facility.  Our company is very active in promoting coordination between the local emergency response agencies and our facility personnel.  Ongoing communication between our facility and the emergency responders is a integral part of our operations.
